intro: Cleanthes brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian throatwort, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves and produces small, greenish flowers that appear in spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
